title: Dudley Sirisena hints at bringing latest helicopter to Sri Lanka
England captain Stokes suffers facial injury after being hit by ball
byline: England Test captain Ben Stokes suffered a facial injury after being hit by a ball while coaching Durham’s academy.

title: Sri Lanka urge Pakistan to reconsider India game boycott
byline: Sri Lanka’s cricket board on Thursday asked Pakistan to reconsider its decision to boycott their first-round encounter with arch-rival India in the T20 World Cup co-hosted by the island.

title: Special traffic and security measures in place for ICC T20 World Cup in Colombo
byline: The Colombo Traffic Division has announced a special traffic management plan to be implemented in Colombo during the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament, which will be held from 07 February to 08 March 2026.

title: Trump endorses Japan’s Takaichi ahead of snap election
byline: Donald Trump has endorsed Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of a snap election in her country on Sunday.

title: Mafia behind escalating prices of lands, housing: Deputy Minister
byline: A situation has arisen where prices of lands, houses and housing schemes have begun to escalate sharply, Deputy Minister of Urban Development Eranga Gunasekara said yesterday, calling it a mafia.

title: Supreme Court’s green light for abolition of MPs’ pension
byline: The Supreme Court has held that the proposed MPs Pension Repeal Bill is consistent with the Constitution and can be approved by a simple majority.

title: Sri Lanka still among the worst in the world to protect the environment?
byline: Sri Lanka ranked 134 out of 180 countries in the latest Environmental Protection Index (EPI) report compiled by Yale and Colombia universities with a score of 38.8 out of 100 on their national efforts to protect environmental health.

title: Helicopter rehearses landing at Kandy President’s house premises ahead of AKD’s visit
byline: A special rehearsal was conducted to assess whether Sri Lanka Air Force helicopters could land on the open ground behind the Kandy President’s House.

title: Sri Lanka looks to introduce skydiving for tourism
byline: A meeting to study the feasibility of introducing skydiving activities in Sri Lanka was held at the Ministry of Defence yesterday by Defence Secretary Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) and a group of representatives of Skydive Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. risking reform credibility with vehicle permit carve-outs: Advocata
byline: The Advocata Institute yesterday said that any move by the Government to revive or accommodate vehicle permit concessions for a select group of retired senior public officials would undermine governance credibility, weaken public trust, and dilute Sri Lanka’s economic reform effort.

title: Sri Lanka to demand compensation from UK for damages, theft of assets during colonial period: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka intends asking for compensation from the UK for damages of properties, thefts and loss of lives that had taken place during the colonial period, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath told Parliament today.

title: Businessman challenges constitutionality of Protection of Occupants Bill before SC
byline: A businessman has filed a Special Determination petition before the Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of the proposed Protection of Occupants Bill, 2025.

title: Ambuluwawa cable car to resume if no environmental damage found: Minister
byline: Minister of Environment Dhammika Patabendi engaged in an observation tour of the Ambuluwawa Biodiversity Complex yesterday to assess the current status of the proposed development projects, including the controversial cable car initiative.

title: Anusha Palpita further remanded
byline: Anusha Palpita, former Director General of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over the alleged unlawful acquisition of assets worth nearly Rs. 46 million, was ordered to be further remanded till February 20 by Colombo Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Sri Lanka gears up to face potential Nipah virus threat
byline: Sri Lanka has strengthened its preparedness to detect and respond to a potential outbreak of the deadly Nipah virus (NiV) with health authorities stepping up surveillance and laboratory readiness amid growing regional concerns.
